musicalLanguage.description: Alan Silvestri's gentle piano theme accompanies the floating feather in Forrest Gump's opening and closing scenes. The melody is built on simple, stepwise motion in C major with a childlike innocence that mirrors Forrest's character. The arrangement is deliberately sparse — the beauty comes from the simplicity and the space between notes. This is music about floating, not flying.
musicalLanguage.structure: Feather floating: gentle ascending figures (4 bars), Settling: descending resolution (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The feather begins its journey — gentle ascending thirds.
Bars 3-4: The melody drifts higher — weightless and innocent.
Bars 7-8: The feather lands — the simplest, most peaceful resolution.
teachingGoals: Gentle, controlled touch at soft dynamics
Playing simple music beautifully — less is more
Pedal technique for creating a floating, resonant sound
styleTips: Imagine a feather floating on the breeze — weightless, drifting
Never play louder than mp — this music is about quietness
Use plenty of sustain pedal — let the notes blend and float

measures.teachingNote: C major — the feather lifts off. Two gentle notes. Nothing more needed.
F major — the feather drifts. A to G, gentle rocking motion.
Dm — slight descent. The feather catches a downdraft.
G major — rising again. The feather is carried upward.
C major — a little higher now. The quietest crescendo.
F major — beginning to descend. The feather is finding its way down.
G major — almost there. Two notes, descending. Getting quieter.
C major — the feather has landed. One whole note each hand. Silence.
